title: [chore][cli] Improve argparse usage in sim.py main
[M][sim] there should be a feedback loop in the main 'tick'
description:
2. Feedback loops (food scarcity affects births) ⭐⭐⭐⭐
Second most important.
Why it matters:

Currently: rabbits multiply regardless of grass availability (unrealistic)
With feedback: starvation when grass runs low → population crashes → recoveries
Creates boom/bust cycles naturally
Makes the ecosystem feel interconnected

Impact: Turns it from 3 independent exponentials into an actual ecosystem

title: [L][refactor] update 'commit world' / 'create world' / 'update readme' etc to be under 'commands/' dir, and use argparse SUB parsers ; ./sim.py should be single entry

title: help

[L][worlds][refactor] Multi-world state management overhaul
description: Move to worlds/<name>/ state/history/snapshot layout, change sim.py to take positional world names, update update_readme.py + workflow, add helper script, and migrate prod/dev data.

title: [M][sim][worlds] Rework sim.py for positional world arguments
description: Replace --prod/--dev flags with positional world names, create worlds/<name>/ structure, update file paths, ensure directories/history init, and keep --snapshot support.

title: [S][script][docs] Update README + update_readme.py for worlds/prod snapshots
description: Read snapshot from worlds/prod/snapshot.md (configurable later) and document the new worlds directory scheme and commands.

title: [S][ci][workflow] Adjust GitHub Action for worlds/prod layout
description: Update the daily workflow to run python sim.py prod --snapshot and commit worlds/prod/* plus README changes.

title: [S][repo][migration] Move existing prod/dev assets into worlds/
description: Create worlds/prod with state/history/snapshot, add worlds/dev (gitignored) structure, migrate state_prod.json and history.csv, and clean up old root files/gitignore.

comments.author: david
comments.text: Initialized long-lived `staging` world via `python create_world.py staging`, ran a tick + snapshot, and confirmed README updates can target `worlds/staging/`.

title: [XS][script][helper] create_world.py bootstrap tool
description: Optional script to initialize new worlds and optionally copy from an existing world (e.g., python create_world.py staging-v2 --from=prod).

title: [S][docs][gitignore] Update ignorables + README migration notes
description: Clean up .gitignore entries for old state files/history/snapshot, document migration/testing steps in README, and note the new directory structure.

title: [XS][ci][staging] Manual workflow trigger for staging world
description: Extend the daily workflow (workflow_dispatch) to accept a world input (default prod) so maintainers can run python sim.py <world> --snapshot for staging on demand.

title: [S][chore] update all beads agents instruction (in docs/ too) too emphasize should use '--json' flag
[chore][env] Document venv usage and setup
[M][snapshot][automation] README Snapshot Publishing Epic
description: Automate generating a world snapshot from sim.py, writing it to README via update script, and wiring it into the daily workflow and local tooling.

title: [S][sim][snapshot] Implement snapshot generator + CLI flag
description: Add the generate_snapshot helper and --snapshot flag in sim.py, writing snapshots to snapshot.md when invoked alongside dev/prod ticks.

title: [S][script][docs] Create snapshot update script + README markers
description: Add update_readme.py that replaces content between <!-- SNAPSHOT START/END --> and seed README.md with the snapshot block placeholder.

title: [S][ci][automation] Wire snapshot + README updates into daily workflow
description: Run python sim.py --prod --snapshot, invoke update_readme.py, and commit README/state/history/snapshot outputs inside .github/workflows/daily.yml.

title: [XS][repo][gitignore] Track snapshot artifact expectations
description: Add snapshot.md to .gitignore (alongside state_dev.json) so local runs don't dirty the tree while Actions commits the prod snapshot copy.

title: [S][testing][docs] Document local snapshot testing steps
description: Capture the manual flow for running python sim.py --dev --snapshot, inspecting snapshot.md, updating README via update_readme.py, and reverting changes for dry runs.
